author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Melbourne Airport July Passenger Traffic ResultsTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Melbourne Airport July Passenger Traffic Results
Melbourne Airport achieved 7 per cent international growth in July compared to the same period last year, to reach 774,315 international passengers.
Asia continued its growth surge with strong growth by China as well as Indonesia and Malaysia which reflected the earlier start to Ramadan celebrations. New Zealand also grew strongly with more than 16 cent compared to July 2014.
Supporting Melbourne’s continuing growth, and welcomed by Melbourne Airport, was Emirates’ recent announcement to upgrade its current Dubai-Singapore-Melbourne service to A380s.
Domestically, passengers increased by 5 per cent to take domestic passengers to 2,154,079 while total passengers reached 2,928,394.
Passenger figures for July 2015: PASSENGERS JULY 2015 JULY 2014 GROWTH (%)* International 774,315 725,489 6.7 Domestic 2,154,079 2,046,830 5.2 Total (excl.transits) 2,928,394 2,772,319 5.6 *monthly percentage growth compared to July 2014
Strong performing nationalities by passport holders for July 2015: NORTH ASIA (%)* SOUTH EAST ASIA (%)* EUROPE (%)* OTHER (%)* China 16.8 Indonesia 35.0 Spain 24.2 New Zealand 16.1 Hong Kong 12.5 Malaysia 15.4 France 9.9 Australia 4.4 Sri Lanka 12.3 Netherlands 8.2 USA 3.6 India 8.1 UK 0.9 Canada 2.0 *monthly percentage growth compared to July 2014
Quote: s attributable to Mr Simon Gandy, Acting CEO Melbourne Airport:
“We are delighted with Emirates’ announcement to introduce A380s on their Dubai-Singapore-Melbourne flights. It’s another example of confidence in the Melbourne market and in particular for the popular Singapore market. We look forward to working with Emirates and other airlines to continue to increase capacity to our wonderful city and state.”
“Our 24 hour operations are a key advantage and vital to continuing growth across the international and domestic network. As Victoria’s aviation gateway, Melbourne Airport continues to provide airlines with greater scheduling flexibility, and passengers with more convenient travelling options.”
Source:- Melbourne Airport
